title: The Story Behind the Docuseries Desperately Seeking Soulmate: Escaping Twin Flames Universe
description: Jeff and Shaleia Ayan, the leaders of the Twin Flames Universe—something akin to a spiritual reality show that alleges to be therapeutic—will tell you that it’s not a cult. Some former members will tell you that it is. And Alice Hines—the investigative journalist who wrote the Vanity Fair article “Inside the Always Online, All-Consuming World…

title: South African Singer Tyla Makes Waves on TikTok With Viral “Water” Dance Challenge
description: South African singer Tyla's song "Water" is a catchy earworm on TikTok that has spawned a viral dance craze.

title: Read the Nobel Peace Laureate’s Gripping Account of the Fire in Her Prison
description: The Nobel Peace Prize laureate Narges Mohammadi's account of a fire last year inside Evin Prison in Tehran

title: A New Book Tells a Palestinian Story from Behind the Wall
description: A new book tells in moving detail the story of a Palestinian man searching for his son.

title: The Best Exorcist Is the One Almost Everyone Hates
description: The greatest, strangest Exorcist film may be neither the first nor the most recent; in fact, it’s the one almost everyone hates, though how anyone can resist the totally out-there vision of James Earl Jones in a locust headdress is beyond me.

title: U.S. Warns E.U.’s Landmark AI Policy Will Only Benefit Big Tech
description: The U.S. warned the E.U. that its proposed law to regulate AI would favor companies with resources and hurt smaller firms, documents show.

title: The Fight Over AIDS-Relief Program PEPFAR Could Have Far-Reaching Consequences
description: The program has saved over 25 millions lives from AIDS. Now PEPFAR faces an uncertain future in Congress.

title: The Exorcist: Believer Director on Making a Modern Possession Movie
description: The Exorcist: Believer director David Gordon Green talks rebooting a horror classic for today's moviegoers

title: Drew Barrymore Show Writers Refusing to Return Signals a New Era in Hollywood
description: Three former Drew Barrymore Show writers decline to return after the end of the WGA strike. It's a signal of change in Hollywood.

title: How U.S. Hospitals Undercut Public Health
description: The U.S. health care industry is one of the world’s worst polluters, causing many of the deaths it seeks to prevent.

title: Whales and Dolphins in U.S. Waters Are Losing Food and Habitat to Climate Change
description: NOAA scientists found large whales such as humpbacks and North Atlantic right whales were among the most vulnerable to climate change.

title: Millions of Children Displaced Due To Extreme Weather. Climate Change Will Make It Worse
description: Climate change will make things worse. A UNICEF report expects more than 113 million children to be displaced in the next 30 years.

title: How Marvel Lost Its Way
description: As 'Loki' returns and with 'The Marvels' on the horizon, the studio is floundering in a sea of B-list superheroes, convoluted plots, and an unwieldy volume of shows.

title: Book Bans Aren’t the Only Threat to Literature in American Classrooms
description: Book bans aren't the only threat to literature in American classrooms.

title: The Rousing True Story Behind The Burial
description: Director Maggie Betts on her courtroom drama starring Tommy Lee Jones and Jamie Foxx, based on a David and Goliath 1990s court case.

title: Dicks: The Musical Confuses Making Comedy With Inflicting It on an Audience
description: The musical comedy is so raucously pleased with its absurdist gags that it feels less like a movie and more like an outré bingo card.

title: More Americans Are Living to 100. Get Ready for the Super-Aging Era
description: Get ready for the super-aging era, writes William J. Kole.

title: Scrooge’s Secret to Living Your Best Life
description: Ebenezer Scrooge played by society’s scoreboard until he realized that wasn't what mattered

title: The Unwavering Confidence of Deion Sanders
description: How Coach Prime is changing college football forever

title: Jailed Iranian Activist Narges Mohammadi Wins the Nobel Peace Prize. Here’s What to Know
description: Narges, who is serving a 10-year sentence in Tehran, was honored “for her fight against the oppression of women in Iran.”

title: How India’s Hindu Nationalists Are Weaponizing History Against Muslims
description: The BJP is spreading a false history about the Mughal empire and more to spread its Hindu nationalist vision.

title: Putin Backs India’s Bid for a Permanent Seat in U.N. Security Council, Despite China Opposition
description: Russia’s diplomatic ally China is strongly opposed to the proposal.

title: Who Is Anthony Pratt, the Australian Billionaire Trump Allegedly Shared Nuclear Secrets With?
description: After Trump allegedly shared details of U.S. nuclear submarines, Anthony Pratt reportedly went on to tell “scores of others,” including foreign officials, journalists, and employees.

title: Financial Firms Are Flocking to Singapore But Hong Kong Keeps Its Edge
description: Hong Kong is still the first stop for businesses looking to crack the world’s second-largest economy; Singapore’s economic backyard in Southeast Asia is far smaller.

title: After Awkward Ascension, Thailand’s New Prime Minister Tries Old-Fashioned Populism
description: Political observers worry that the policies of Srettha’s first month, designed to win public confidence, are either symbolic or, worse, shortsighted.

title: Russia’s Latest Threat: New Nuclear Tests
description: Russia is using nuclear sabre-rattling in search of leverage on Ukraine, Western experts say.
